column4: n}}) was a descendent of [[Bëor]], and a member of [[Barahir's Outlaw Band]].

column1: Baragund was the son of [[Bregolas]]. He had only one daughter, [[Morwen]], with an unnamed wife.<ref>{{WJ
column2: 14}}, ''(i) House of Bëor'',  p. 231</ref> Baragund and his brother Belegund partook in the [[Dagor Bragollach]] under the command of their uncle [[Barahir]]. They survived, but were beaten back.<ref>{{S
column3: Fingolfin}}</ref> With Barahir and ten others, they formed a small band and lived as [[Barahir's Outlaw Band

column1: They lived in hiding for some time, until [[Morgoth]]'s agents captured [[Gorlim]] and coerced him into giving the location of their hideaway. [[Orcs]] were sent to raid it, and succeeded. Baragund and the outlaws were killed. Only [[Beren]] survived, as he had been away on an errand.<ref>{{S
